title: Most effective particle collision NO and NO3

content.question:
NO(g) + NO3(g) â†’ 2 NO2(g)

The reaction between NO(g) and NO3(g) is represented by the equation above. Which of the

following orientations of collision between NO(g) and NO3(g) is most likely to be effective?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of the collision between a molecule of N O, gas, and a molecule of N O 3, gas, such that the O atom of the N O will collide with an O atom of the N O 3.
The figure presents a diagram of the collision between a molecule of N O, gas, and a molecule of N O 3, gas, such that the O atom of the N O will collide with the N atom of the N O 3.
The figure presents a diagram of the collision between a molecule of N O, gas, and a molecule of N O 3, gas, such that the N atom of the N O will collide with the N atom of the N O 3.
The figure presents a diagram of the collision between a molecule of N O, gas, and a molecule of N O 3, gas, such that the N atom of the N O will collide with an O atom of the N O 3.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram of the collision between a molecule of N O, gas, and a molecule of N O 3, gas, such that the N atom of the N O will collide with an O atom of the N O 3.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
